page.title: 03FARMING AROUND MILDENHALL
page.content: Modern British farming has the following characteristics. Firstly our farms are highly {mechanised.}We use combine harvesters, tractors, ploughs, seed drills, bailers and many other machines.This means that not so many workers are needed.Secondly our wheat and barley are now{specially bred varieties, which are also high yielding.The crops are sprayed with pesticides, insecticides and fungicides.This means that we can have better quality wheat and barley.The third characteristic is {chicken factories.}The farm that I went to, Littlecote Park Farm, had about 9,000 chickens.The chickens live in a controlled and artificial environment. On some farms the same happens with pigs.They are packed into one pen where they are quite cramped.
